messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] raffle was Re:resource day/gaming
messages.msgSnippet: I usually agree w/ the it sounds like an ad But I really have little or no idea what to contribute.  Believe me, I really don t want to offend anyone.
messages.messageBody:
I usually agree w/ the "it sounds like an ad"
But I really have little or no idea what to contribute. Believe me, I
really don't want to offend anyone.

BTW..it's warmed up here!! 21 degrees!
Janis

-----Original Message-----
From: Fetteroll [mailto:fetteroll@...]
Sent: Saturday, February 15, 2003 9:56 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] raffle was Re:resource day/gaming

on 2/15/03 7:58 AM, coyote's corner at jana@... wrote:

> Hi,
> I don't know what y'all are talking about, but I often contribute.
> I have an on-line store.
>
> We're adding to it. Some of the items will be about Homeschool and
unschool.
>
> Is it okay to post the site?

The raffle is something Kelly Lovejoy set up at her conference in South
Carolina last year and she's planning another one for the conference this
year.

My personal feeling is that regardless of how useful a site may be, if the
person mentioning it is selling something it feels like an ad. But it's okay
to put a link in your sig line.

Joyce
Unschooling-dotcom moderator

messages.messageBody:
I wasn't expecting the raffle last year. I'm going to have to bring more
cash this year. I can just tell. ;-)

Barb E
"Each human being is bred with a unique set of potentials
that yearn to be fulfilled as surely as the acorn yearns
to become the oak within it."

- Aristotle, Philosopher

messages.messageBody:
Hi,
I don't know what y'all are talking about, but I often contribute.
I have an on-line store.

We're adding to it. Some of the items will be about Homeschool and unschool.

Is it okay to post the site?
Sandra, Joyce??
